Retrieve, Modify, and Destroy Components From framework Object

Source: R/framework-helpers.R
retrieval.Rd

These functions are essentially helper functions to simplify the manipulation of framework objects. They may retrieve or modify or destroy components of the framework object as described.

Retrieval functions:

  • get_data() retrieves the data set associated with a specified hypothesis and data name

  • get_test() retrieves the test associated with a hypothesis

  • get_formulae() retrieves the list of formulaes associated with a hypothesis and data set.

Reporting functions

  • report_stage() creates a message to identify at what stage a hypothesis has been developed to.

Update functions:

  • update_status() modifies the components of a framework, usually used internally to help update the stage/status of the specified object

get_data(x, name)

get_test(x, name)

get_combination(x, name)

get_formulae(x, name)

get_parameters(x, name)

update_status(x, name, stage = NA, run = FALSE)

Arguments

x

framework object
name

Name of hypothesis object to pull components from
...

For optional parameters

Value

The get_*() functions return the named object from the framework. The update_*() functions return the entire framework after modification.
